resources.string: Pings the Tappy requesting a ping in response
Request the hardware version of the Tappy
Request the battery level of the Tappy
Request the version of the firmware
Set the tappy to ignore it when the same tag is tapped repeatedly
Enable BLE PIN pairing with specified PIN
After clearing bonding cache the device will be unpaired with the TappyBLE, and then a new pairing can be established. THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE
Sets a configuration item value on the Tappy
Allows user to specify boot configurations for the Tappy
Request the boot configuration of the Tappy
Request the version of the basic NFC library
Command the Tappy to scan for an NDEF-formatted tags
Command the Tappy to stream NDEF-formatted tags
Command the Tappy to scan for NFC tags
Command the Tappy to stream NFC tags
The Tappy will report the tag\'s UID and any NDEF message discovered for the first tag detected
The Tappy will report the tag\'s UID and any NDEF message discovered for the first tag detected or continuously when enabled as long as the timeout has not expired
Command the Tappy to stop doing whatever it is doing
Command the Tappy to write text to tags
Command the Tappy to write a link to tags
Command the Tappy to emulate an NDEF tag with text as the payload
Command the Tappy to emulate an NDEF tag with a URI as the payload
Command the Tappy to lock a tag
Command the Tappy to transmit data to or receive data from an iPhone or Android device
Receive automated alerts when tags enter and exit the detection area of the Tappy
Receive automated alerts when tags enter and exit the detection area of the Tappy, including any discovered NDEF messages
Request the version of the MIFARE Classic library
Read data from a MIFARE Classic. For this example, the Tappy will always attempt to authenticate with key A using the default key
Scan for a Type 4 tag using either Type A or Type B modulation. If you are unsure what type of modulation your tags use, Type A is the most common.
Scan for an active target for type 4 card emulation.
Request the version of the Type 4 library
Request the version of the NTAG 21X library
Read Password-Protected NDEF w/ Password Bytes
Read NDEF data protected with password bytes from an NTAG 21X
Read password-protected NDEF data from an NTAG 21X
Write Password-Protected Text w/ Password Bytes
Write text protected with password bytes to an NTAG 21X. When the toggle below is unset, the tag will be write protected. When set, the tag will be read and write protected.
Write password-protected text to an NTAG 21X. When the toggle below is unset, the tag will be write protected. When set, the tag will be read and write protected.
Write Password-Protected URL w/ Password Bytes
Write a URL protected with password bytes to an NTAG 21X. When the toggle below is unset, the tag will be write protected. When set, the tag will be read and write protected.
Write a password-protected URL to an NTAG 21X. When the toggle below is unset, the tag will be write protected. When set, the tag will be read and write protected.
Change the Read NDEF password by entering the current 16 byte password and the new 16 byte password
Change the write NDEF password by entering the current 16 byte password and the new 16 byte password
Enter Password to Lock NDEF Write Access
Enter password to lock NDEF write access
Enter Password to Lock NDEF Read Access
Enter password to lock NDEF read access
Enter Password to Unlock NDEF Write Access
Enter password to unlock NDEF write access
Enter Password to Unlock NDEF Read Access
Enter password to unlock NDEF read access
Request the I2C protection setting of the STMicro-M24SR02 microchip
Read password-protected NDEF data from an STMicro-M24SR02
Write password-protected NDEF to a STMicro-M24SR02
Enter password to permanently lock NDEF write access
Request the command family version of the STMicro-M24SR02 command family
Request checkin count from Tappy checkin station
Request checkins from Tappy checkin station
Request Standalone Checkin command family version
Request station info from Tappy checkin station
Request time and date from Tappy checkin station
Reports the UID of the checkin card
Reset checkins for Tappy checkin station
Set the station ID for Tappy checkin station
Set the station name for Tappy checkin station
Set the time and date for Tappy checkin station

Debit wrisband and output wristband status

WristCoin offers a full closed-loop NFC payment system for events, venues, and festivals of all sizes. This command family is an SDK to help POS makers integrate cashless closed loop technology into their products. We've made an example demo here to evaluate or even use as a basic POS. Tappy readers featuring WristCoin POS capabilities have to be special ordered from WristCoin directly. If interested, contact WristCoin at:

www.mywristcoin.com
1-800-293-6094
info@mywristcoin.com

Debit wristband and only show resulting wristband balance

Closing out the wristband prevents it from making anymore transactions (THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE)
